onStartJob(android.app.job.JobParameters.Description: Engine's report that a job has started. See @B_android#app#job#JobService#onStartJob_E@ for more information.

jobFinished(android.app.job.JobParameter.Description: Call in to engine to report that a job has finished executing. See @B_android#app#job#JobService#jobFinished_E@ JobService.jobFinished} for more information.
jobFinished(android.app.job.JobParameter.FullName: public void jobFinished (JobParameters params, boolean needsReschedule)

Parameters: Service: The @B_android#app#Service_E@ that is creating this engine and in which it will run.
JobServiceEngine(android.app.Service).Description: Create a new engine, ready for use.

getBinder().Description: Retrieve the engine's IPC interface that should be returned by @B_android#app#Service#onBind_E@.

onStopJob(android.app.job.JobParameters).Description: Engine's report that a job has stopped. See @B_android#app#job#JobService#onStopJob_E@ for more information.

ClassDesc: Helper for implementing a @B_android#app#Service_E@ that interacts with @B_android#app#job#JobScheduler_E@. This is not intended for use by regular applications, but allows frameworks built on top of the platform to create their own @B_android#app#Service_E@ that interact with @B_android#app#job#JobScheduler_E@ as well as add in additional functionality. If you just want to execute jobs normally, you should instead be looking at @B_android#app#job#JobService_E@.
